DataElement.preferredName: Patient Monoclonal Antibody Personal Medical History Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient meets the eligibility criteria for enrollment in a clinical trial based on prior treatment with monoclonal antibodies.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Monoclonal Antibody Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast-growing cells i.e., hybridoma. Hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis, and treatment._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast-growing cells i.e., hybridoma. Hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis, and treatment.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast-growing cells i.e., hybridoma. Hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis, and treatment.

Property.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Admin - Associated Property, Removed duplicate terms from Long Name and duplicate definitions included in Definition after correction was requested by curator. 9/25

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient had a prior monoc
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a prior monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks prior to study Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed from end of monoclonal antibody therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed from end of monoclonal therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4, has it been a minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and  more than 6 weeks from the last dose, and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior monoclonal antibody therapy, was it completed at least 3 half-lives of the antibody or 6 weeks ago?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of a monoclonal antibody at least 3 half-lives prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of a monoclonal antibody at least 30 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4 antibody, was last dose greater than 6 weeks previously and there is no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 antibody (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4  are the following requirements are met: Minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and greater than 6 weeks from the last dose and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4  are the following requirements met: Minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and greater than 6 weeks from the last dose and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior monoclonal antibody therapy, was it completed  more than 6 weeks ago (or  3 half-lives of the antibody whichever is shorter) prior to enrollment on protocol (minimum of 1 week between prior therapy and study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any monoclonal antibody therapy within 4 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior monoclonal antibody therapy, was it completed more than (or equal to) 6 weeks ago (or 3 half-lives of the antibody whichever is shorter) prior to enrollment on protocol (minimum of 1 week between prior therapy and study enrollment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior anti-cancer monoclonal antibody (mAB) within 4 weeks prior to study enrollment, or not recovered (i.e., less than or equal to Grade 1 or at baseline) from adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks prior to enrollment?*

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior monoclonal antibodies less than or equal to 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of a monoclonal antibody the shorter of 3 half-lives or 28 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received anti-cancer mAb within 4 weeks, for a prior, unrelated, curatively-treated malignancy, prior to study registration or has not recovered (recovery defined as baseline or less than or equal to grade 1) from AEs due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a prior anti-cancer mAb within 4 weeks prior to study registration and has not recovered (recovery defined as baseline or less than or equal to grade 1) from adverse events (AEs) due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had prior monoclonal antibody therapy, was it completed greater than or equal to 6 weeks (or 3 half-lives of the antibody, whichever is shorter) prior to enrollment (minimum of 1 week between prior therapy and study enrollment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 21 days elapsed from last dose of prior antibody therapy to initiation of protocol therapy and toxicity related to prior antibody therapy has recovered to less than or equal to grade 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had prior monoclonal antibody therapy was it completed greater than or equal to 6 weeks (or 3 half-lives of the antibody, whichever is shorter) prior to enrollment on protocol (minimum of 1 week between prior therapy and study enrollment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior monoclonal antibody therapy less than 6 weeks (or 3 half-lives of the antibody, whichever is shorter) prior to enrollment on protocol (minimum of 1 week between prior therapy and study enrollment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a prior monoclonal antibody (other than anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 antibody, or anti-PD-L2 therapy) within 4 weeks prior to study Day 1 or has not recovered (i.e., less than or equal to Grade 1 or at baseline) from AEs due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior monoclonal antibody therapy, was it completed greater than or equal to 5 weeks (or 3 half-lives of the antibody, whichever is shorter) prior to enrollment on protocol (minimum of 1 week between prior therapy and study enrollment)?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 5/13/22 CJL AQT added for Theradex for protocol 10405
